UNOISE3 error correction and ZOTU clustering algorithm.

Implements the UNOISE3 algorithm for denoising amplicon sequences into Zero-radius OTUs (ZOTUs). Sequences are sorted by abundance and clustered using the UNOISE skew formula and banded Levenshtein distance.

Reference: Edgar RC. UNOISE2: improved error-correction for Illumina 16S and ITS amplicon sequencing. bioRxiv 081257; doi: 10.1101/081257

Types

Centroid = object
  seqObj*: UnoiseSeq         ## The representative sequence for this centroid
  totalSize*: int            ## Accumulated abundance across all merged sequences
A cluster centroid (ZOTU candidate) produced by unoise. 
UnoiseSeq = object
  id*: string                ## Sequence identifier (from FASTA header, without ``>``)
  seq*: string               ## DNA sequence string
  size*: int                 ## Abundance (copy count) parsed from ``size=`` annotation
An amplicon sequence with its identifier and abundance count.

Procs

proc editDistanceLimit(s1, s2: string; limit: int): int {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Computes the Levenshtein edit distance between s1 and s2 with early termination when the distance would exceed limit.

Uses a banded dynamic-programming approach with O(n) space. Returns limit + 1 as soon as the true distance is known to exceed limit, making it efficient for threshold-based comparisons.

Parameters

  • s1, s2 â€” DNA sequences to compare
  • limit â€” maximum edit distance; returns limit+1 if exceeded
proc extractKmers(s: string; kmers: var seq[uint16]) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Extracts all overlapping 8-mer (octamer) words from sequence s.

Each 8-mer is encoded as a uint16 using 2 bits per base (A=0, C=1, G=2, T/U=3). Ambiguous bases (N, etc.) reset the current k-mer accumulator. The kmers sequence is cleared before filling. Does nothing if s is shorter than 8 bases.

proc unoise(sequences: seq[UnoiseSeq]; alpha: float = 2.0; minsize: int = 8): seq[
    Centroid] {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Runs the UNOISE3 clustering algorithm on a set of dereplicated sequences.

Sequences are processed in descending abundance order. Each sequence is compared against existing centroids using edit distance and the UNOISE skew formula skew = targetSize / querySize. A sequence is merged into the best matching centroid when the number of differences satisfies diffs â‰¤ (log2(skew) - 1) / alpha; otherwise it becomes a new centroid.

Parameters

  • sequences â€” input sequences with size annotations
  • alpha â€” skew exponent controlling stringency (default: 2.0)
  • minsize â€” sequences with fewer copies are skipped (default: 8)

Returns centroids sorted by total abundance (descending). These are ZOTU candidates before chimera filtering.

See also: uchime for chimera removal.
